thread.title: Manchester United take more points from 2016 than City
thread.title_full: Manchester United take more points from 2016 than City

title: Manchester United take more points from 2016 than City
text:
0 Dec 31, 2016 3:42:59 PM A win for the Red Devils coupled with Liverpool's victory over Pep Guardiola's team meant United outperformed their rivals this last year 
With the sheer volume of negative publicity and crisis talk that surrounds Manchester United, one could be forgiven for thinking 2016 has been a total washout. 
But the team now managed by Jose Mourinho in fact enjoyed a wholly respectable year in the Premier League - better, in fact, than their much-vaunted neighbours! 
Wijnaldum strike downs City 
Overall in their 38 league matches in 2016 the Red Devils took a total of 72 points, winning 21 games, drawing nine and losing eight. 
That record sees the club sit in third place overall for the calendar year, behind runaway leaders Chelsea and Liverpool, who leapfrogged United thanks to their win over Pep Guardiola's men. 
City, meanwhile, languish a lowly sixth, level with Arsenal who played a game fewer over the course of the year - the Gunners end their first half of the campaign a day later on January 1, 2017. 
The Citizens nonetheless fare better than reigning 2015-16 champions Leicester City. 
Mou tells Martial: Don't listen to agent 
Claudio Ranieri may have got his hands on the Premier League title back in May, but a dreadful run of form means the Foxes only sit eighth overall for their record over the last 12 months. 
And, coincidentally, the top of the table perfectly mirrors this opening stretch of the 2016-17, with Chelsea sitting pretty six points ahead of closest rivals Liverpool! Related
